author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Famous celebrities who have survived breast cancer
text:
D Dipasupil/FilmMagic Sheryl Crow attends the SNL 40th Anniversary Celebration at Rockefeller Plaza on February 15, 2015 Enlarge Andrew Theodorakis/New York Daily News Actress Cynthia Nixon speaks before Mayor elect Bill De Blasio and his wife Chirlane McCray speak at the NYCC awards night on Tuesday December 3rd, 2013 Enlarge The world goes pink in October to raise awareness for breast cancer — the most commonly diagnosed type of cancer among women.
One in eight women are diagnosed with the disease in their lifetime, an alarming statistic that shows the critical need for lifesaving research.
But a diagnosis is not necessarily a death sentence as the survival rate for women after five years of diagnosis is high.
Here are some examples of brave celebrities who survived breast cancer:
Sheryl Crow
The rock queen was diagnosed in 2004 at the age of 43. She made an appearance at the Grammy Awards shortly after her chemotherapy treatment showing and embracing her bald head.
Richard Shotwell/Richard Shotwell/Invision/AP Christina Applegate arrives at the LA premiere of "Vacation" held at the Regency Village Theatre on Monday, July 27, 2015, in Los Angeles Enlarge Jason Merritt/Getty Images TV personality Giuliana Rancic attends the 87th Annual Academy Awards at Hollywood & Highland Center on February 22, 2015 Enlarge Cynthia Nixon
The "Sex and the City" co-star is a proud breast cancer survivor and an ambassador for the Susan G. Komen Breast Cancer Foundation.
She kept her disease private for two years before revealing that a cancerous tumor had been found in her right breast.
Christina Applegate
The actress was diagnosed at just 36.
Splash/Getty Images Robin Roberts attends "An Evening with Robin Roberts And George Stephanopoulis" at 92nd Street Y on May 1, 2014 in New York City Enlarge Danny Moloshok/Invision for the Television Acad Kathy Bates arrives for the Television Academy’s member event, “An Evening with the Women of American Horror Story,” Tuesday, March 17, 2015 at The Montalban in Hollywood, California. Enlarge In 2008, she went public with her decision to get a double mastectomy in the hopes to raise awareness among young women.
Giuliana Rancic
The E News! host announced in 2013 that she was diagnosed with an early stage of breast cancer at 36 years old.
Since then, she has tried to educate women about how to be on top of their own health.
Robin Roberts
George Burns/George Burns Wanda Sykepresents Herlacious series in 2013 In 2007, the "Good Morning America" host found out that she had an early form of breast cancer.
She has shared many aspects of her journey with her audience and created segments with informative information about breast cancer.
Kathy Bates
The award-winning actress was diagnosed with both breast and ovarian cancer undergoing a double mastectomy in 2012.
Wanda Sykes
The comedian spoke about her scary experience on the Ellen Degeneres show.
After going for a breast reduction, her doctors found that she had DCIS, or stage 0 breast cancer. She underwent a double mastectomy.
